snippet: This year will be the first test of a new kind of election aimed at breaking the partisan gridlock that has seized Congress and state legislatures all over the country.
abstract: Californians will participate for the first time in non-partisan primaries in which the two candidates who receive the most votes will go on to the November elections, regardless of their affiliation; system, intended to break partisan gridlock, was created by ballot initiative in 2010.
lead_paragraph: This year will be the first test of a new kind of election aimed at breaking the partisan gridlock that has seized Congress and state legislatures all over the country.

headline.main: Nonpartisan Primaries Face Test in California
headline.print_headline: Nonpartisan Primaries Face Test in California As Way to End Gridlock
